technologies.name: Git
technologies.desc: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

technologies.name: HTML
technologies.desc: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the most basic building block of the Web. It defines the meaning and structure of web content.

technologies.name: CSS
technologies.desc: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a stylesheet language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML.

technologies.name: jQuery
technologies.desc: jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library.

technologies.name: JavaScript
technologies.desc: JavaScript is a lightweight, interpreted, or just-in-time compiled programming language with first-class functions.

technologies.name: Bootstrap
technologies.desc: Bootstrap is a free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development.

technologies.name: Node.js
technologies.desc: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

technologies.name: MySQL
technologies.desc: MySQL Database Service is a fully managed database service to deploy cloud-â€‹native applications.

technologies.name: MongoDB
technologies.desc: MongoDB is a general purpose, document-based, distributed database built for modern application developers and for the cloud era.

technologies.name: Semantic UI
technologies.desc: Semantic is a development framework that helps create beautiful, responsive layouts using human-friendly HTML.

technologies.name: React.js
technologies.desc: React is a library for building composable user interfaces. It encourages the creation of reusable UI components, which present data that changes over time.

technologies.name: Handlebars
technologies.desc: Handlebars is a simple templating language. It uses a template and an input object to generate HTML or other text formats. Handlebars templates look like regular text with embedded Handlebars expressions

technologies.name: Canvas API
technologies.desc: The Canvas API provides a means for drawing graphics via JavaScript and the HTML <canvas> element.

technologies.name: Service Workers
technologies.desc: A service worker is a script that your browser runs in the background, separate from a web page, opening the door to features that don't need a web page or user interaction.

technologies.name: IndexedDB
technologies.desc: IndexedDB is a low-level API for client-side storage of significant amounts of structured data.

technologies.name: Sequelize
technologies.desc: Sequelize is a promise-based Node.js ORM.

technologies.name: Passport
technologies.desc: Passport is authentication middleware for Node.js.

technologies.name: Geolocation API
technologies.desc: The Geolocation API allows the user to provide their location to web applications if they so desire.

technologies.name: OrgHunter API
technologies.desc: The OrgHunter Charity API provides developers access to over 2M charities in our database.

technologies.name: TasteDive API
technologies.desc: TasteDive helps you discover new music, movies, TV shows, books, authors, games, podcasts, and people with shared interests.

technologies.name: Google Books API
technologies.desc: The APIs in the Google Books API Family let you bring Google Books features to your site or application.
